members.member: Need to provide async request options http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/86wf6409(VS.71).aspx

member.name: P:ServiceStack.AsyncServiceClient.GlobalRequestFilter
member.summary: The request filter is called before any request. This request filter is executed globally.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.AsyncServiceClient.GlobalResponseFilter
member.summary: The response action is called once the server response is available. It will allow you to access raw response information. This response action is executed globally. Note that you should NOT consume the response stream as this is handled by ServiceStack

member.name: P:ServiceStack.AsyncServiceClient.OnAuthenticationRequired
member.summary: Called before request resend, when the initial request required authentication

member.name: P:ServiceStack.AsyncServiceClient.RequestFilter
member.summary: The request filter is called before any request. This request filter only works with the instance where it was set (not global).

member.name: P:ServiceStack.AsyncServiceClient.ResponseFilter
member.summary: The response action is called once the server response is available. It will allow you to access raw response information. Note that you should NOT consume the response stream as this is handled by ServiceStack

member.name: P:ServiceStack.AsyncServiceClient.ResultsFilter
member.summary: The ResultsFilter is called before the Request is sent allowing you to return a cached response.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.AsyncServiceClient.ResultsFilterResponse
member.summary: The ResultsFilterResponse is called before returning the response allowing responses to be cached.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.AsyncServiceClient.ExceptionFilter
member.summary: Called with requestUri, ResponseType when server returns 304 NotModified

member.summary: Extends Hashtable based Items container to support storing null-key pairs

member.summary: Implements IEnumerable interface for KeysCollection

member.name: T:ServiceStack.Pcl.NameObjectCollectionBase.KeysCollection
member.summary: SDK: Represents a collection of the String keys of a collection.

member.summary: Gets the number of keys in the NameObjectCollectionBase.KeysCollection

member.summary: SDK: Returns an enumerator that can iterate through the NameObjectCollectionBase.KeysCollection.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Pcl.NameObjectCollectionBase.#ctor
member.summary: SDK: Initializes a new instance of the NameObjectCollectionBase class that is empty.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Pcl.NameObjectCollectionBase.GetEnumerator
member.summary:
SDK: Returns an enumerator that can iterate through the NameObjectCollectionBase.
This enumerator returns the keys of the collection as strings.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.Pcl.NameObjectCollectionBase.IsReadOnly
member.summary: SDK: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the NameObjectCollectionBase instance is read-only.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Pcl.NameObjectCollectionBase.BaseAdd(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds an Item with the specified key and value into the NameObjectCollectionBase instance.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Pcl.NameObjectCollectionBase.BaseGet(System.Int32)
member.summary: SDK: Gets the value of the entry at the specified index of the NameObjectCollectionBase instance.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Pcl.NameObjectCollectionBase.BaseGet(System.String)
member.summary: SDK: Gets the value of the first entry with the specified key from the NameObjectCollectionBase instance.
member.remark: CAUTION: The BaseGet method does not distinguish between a null reference which is returned because the specified key is not found and a null reference which is returned because the value associated with the key is a null reference.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Pcl.NameObjectCollectionBase.BaseGetAllKeys
member.summary: SDK:Returns a String array that contains all the keys in the NameObjectCollectionBase instance.
member.returns: A String array that contains all the keys in the NameObjectCollectionBase instance.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Pcl.NameObjectCollectionBase.BaseGetAllValues
member.summary: SDK: Returns an Object array that contains all the values in the NameObjectCollectionBase instance.
member.returns: An Object array that contains all the values in the NameObjectCollectionBase instance.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Pcl.NameObjectCollectionBase.BaseHasKeys
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the NameObjectCollectionBase instance contains entries whose keys are not a null reference
member.returns: true if the NameObjectCollectionBase instance contains entries whose keys are not a null reference otherwise, false.

members.member: This function implemented the way Microsoft implemented it - item is removed from hashtable and array without considering the case when there are two items with the same key but different values in array. E.g. if hashtable is [("Key1","value1")] and array contains [("Key1","value1")("Key1","value2")] then after RemoveAt(1) the collection will be in following state: hashtable:[] array: [("Key1","value1")] It's ok only then the key is uniquely assosiated with the value To fix it a comparsion of objects stored under the same key in the hashtable and in the arraylist should be added >

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Pcl.NameObjectCollectionBase.BaseSet(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: SDK: Sets the value of the entry at the specified index of the NameObjectCollectionBase instance.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Pcl.NameObjectCollectionBase.BaseSet(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the value of the first entry with the specified key in the NameObjectCollectionBase instance, if found; otherwise, adds an entry with the specified key and value into the NameObjectCollectionBase instance.
member.param: The String key of the entry to set. The key can be a null reference
The Object that represents the new value of the entry to set. The value can be a null reference

members.member:
in SDK doc: If the same value already exists under the same key in the collection, it just adds one more value in other words after
NameValueCollection nvc; nvc.Add ("LAZY","BASTARD") nvc.Add ("LAZY","BASTARD")
nvc.Get ("LAZY") will be "BASTARD,BASTARD" instead of "BASTARD"

member.name: M:ServiceStack.ResponseStatusUtils.CreateResponseStatus(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{ServiceStack.Validation.ValidationErrorField})
member.summary:
Creates the error response from the values provided.
If the errorCode is empty it will use the first validation error code, if there is none it will throw an error.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.ServiceClientBase.Credentials
member.summary: Gets or sets authentication information for the request. Warning: It's recommened to use and for basic auth. This property is only used for IIS level authentication.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.ServiceClientBase.AlwaysSendBasicAuthHeader
member.summary: Determines if the basic auth header should be sent with every request. By default, the basic auth header is only sent when "401 Unauthorized" is returned.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.ServiceClientBase.StoreCookies
member.summary: Specifies if cookies should be stored

member.name: P:ServiceStack.ServiceClientBase.OnAuthenticationRequired
member.summary: Called before request resend, when the initial request required authentication

member.name: P:ServiceStack.ServiceClientBase.RefreshToken
member.summary: If a request fails with a 401 Unauthorized and a BearerToken is present the client will automatically fetch a new AccessToken using this RefreshToken and retry the request

member.name: P:ServiceStack.ServiceClientBase.RefreshTokenUri
member.summary: Send the Request to get the AccessToken with the RefreshToken at a non-default location

member.name: P:ServiceStack.ServiceClientBase.ResponseFilter
member.summary: The response action is called once the server response is available. It will allow you to access raw response information. Note that you should NOT consume the response stream as this is handled by ServiceStack

member.name: M:ServiceStack.ServiceClientBase.HandleResponseException``1(System.Exception,System.Object,System.String,System.Func{System.Net.WebRequest},System.Func{System.Net.WebRequest,System.Net.WebResponse},``0@)
member.summary: Called by Send method if an exception occurs, for instance a System.Net.WebException because the server returned an HTTP error code. Override if you want to handle specific exceptions or always want to parse the response to a custom ErrorResponse DTO type instead of ServiceStack's ErrorResponse class. In case ex is a System.Net.WebException, do not use createWebRequest/getResponse/HandleResponse<TResponse> to parse the response because that will result in the same exception again. Use ThrowWebServiceException<YourErrorResponseType> to parse the response and to throw a WebServiceException containing the parsed DTO. Then override Send to handle that exception.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.ServiceClientBase.Get(System.Object)
member.summary: APIs returning HttpWebResponse must be explicitly Disposed, e.g using (var res = client.Get(url)) { ... }

member.name: M:ServiceStack.ServiceClientBase.Get(System.String)
member.summary: APIs returning HttpWebResponse must be explicitly Disposed, e.g using (var res = client.Get(url)) { ... }

member.name: T:ServiceStack.UrlExtensions
member.summary:
Donated by Ivan Korneliuk from his post: http://korneliuk.blogspot.com/2012/08/servicestack-reusing-dtos.html
Modified to only allow using routes matching the supplied HTTP Verb

member.summary: Generate a url from a Request DTO. Pretty URL generation require Routes to be defined using `[Route]` on the Request DTO
